text: The Minghetti II Cabinet held office from 10 July 1973 until 25 March 1976, a total of 989 days, or 2 year, 8 months and 15 days.Governo Minghetti II ==Government parties== The government was composed by the following parties: {| class=wikitable style="font-size:100%" |- !colspan=2|Party !Ideology !Leader |- | bgcolor="" | | Historical Right | Conservatism | Marco Minghetti |} ==Composition== {|class="wikitable" style="font-size: 100%;" |- ! Minister of Foreign Affairs | Emilio Visconti Venosta | bgcolor="" | | Historical Right | (1873–1876) |- ! Minister of War | Cesare Ricotti-Magnani | bgcolor="" | | Military | (1873–1876) |- ! Minister of the Navy | Simone Antonio Saint-Bon | bgcolor="" | | Military | (1873–1876) |- ! Minister of Agriculture, Industry and Commerce | Gaspare Finali | bgcolor="" | | Historical Right | (1873–1876) |- !
